body: TODAY WHEN-ever I visit my old neighborhood of Bedford-Stuyvesant and walk along Fulton Street or Nostrand Avenue, its twin commercial hubs, I have to remind myself that I'm in Brooklyn and not in the middle of a teeming outdoor market in St. George's, Grenada, or Kingston, Jamaica, or on some other West Indian island. title: RISING ISLANDERS OF BED-STUY

body: THE two-family house, long a fixture in many older residential neighborhoods, is a practical way of cutting housing costs because rent from the second unit helps offset the owner's mortgage and maintenance costs. Nonetheless, the two-family house has never quite managed to shake off its plebian image vis-a-vis the single-family house, and prices
title: TALKING TWO FAMILIES; The Merits Of Condo Conversion

body: SINGLE-FAMILY homes in New York generally come in two price ranges: expensive and unbelievably expensive. As a result, people who have believable incomes and who prefer running their own house to cooperative or condominium living often become landlords - they buy a building with one or more rental apartments that help pay the bills. But this
title: LIVING WITH TENANTS: AN OWNER'S GUIDE

title: Future Events

body: SEASONED officials of New York City cooperatives and their professional advisers consider this Tuesday a significant date. It is the day when the Real Property Assessment Bureau of New York City's Department of Finance will publish its tentative list of assessment figures for the taxable year 1985-86, which starts July 1. title: TALKING ASSESSMENTS; CHANGES AFFECTING CO-OPS
